head.title: United Nations To Help Lebanon Investigation

hedline.hl1: United Nations To Help Lebanon Investigation

abstract.p: Security Council approves request from Lebanon's prime minister to have United Nations commission ivestigating 2005 assassination of former Prime Min Rafik Hariri help investigate killing of legislator Walid Eido; Eido and Hariri died similarly in car bombings and both opposed past Syrian domination of Lebanon's politics; preliminary findings implicate Syrian intelligence services in Hariri's murder (S)

block.p: The Security Council approved a request from Lebanon's prime minister to have the United Nations commission investigating the 2005 assassination of the former Lebanese prime minister, Rafik Hariri, help investigate last week's killing of a legislator, Walid Eido. Mr. Eido died in an attack similar to the one that had killed Mr. Hariri, when a vehicle parked along the same road in Beirut blew up as his car passed. Like Mr. Hariri, Mr. Eido was opposed to past Syrian domination of Lebanon's politics. Preliminary findings of the commission have implicated Syrian intelligence services in Mr. Hariri's murder.

The Security Council approved a request from Lebanon's prime minister to have the United Nations commission investigating the 2005 assassination of the former Lebanese prime minister, Rafik Hariri, help investigate last week's killing of a legislator, Walid Eido. Mr. Eido died in an attack similar to the one that had killed Mr. Hariri, when a vehicle parked along the same road in Beirut blew up as his car passed. Like Mr. Hariri, Mr. Eido was opposed to past Syrian domination of Lebanon's politics. Preliminary findings of the commission have implicated Syrian intelligence services in Mr. Hariri's murder.
